duties_responsibilities.duty: Identifying patient's alterations in health and assessing the patient's human response to health problems.
Implementing nursing interventions based on theoretical concepts from nursing and other arts and sciences.
Evaluating the effectiveness of nursing interventions to achieve optimal patient outcomes.
Supervising/directing care provided by licensed practical nurses and unlicensed assistive personnel.
Assigning/delegating care to other qualified members of the health care team.
Coordinating care between other professional disciplines as needed.
Performing unit-based activities that contribute to a positive work and professional environment.
Providing and coordinating care to achieve the organization's mission of excellent patient care and nursing's vision of setting a new standard of excellence.
Committed to patient advocacy and innovative patient care in a climate of trust and collaboration.

education_certification.credential: BSN and professional nursing board certification preferred at time of hire. All nurses hired after April 30, 2014 without a BSN will be required to obtain a BSN within three years of hire.
Current RN license in the state of Florida.
